translated: One fascicle of Great Vehicle Pure Land Praises
The Dharma mirror illuminates the void, the mind penetrates the five colors, the manifested mind is subtly observed and pure.
The Dharma realm also penetrates the void, the wish-fulfilling pearl is always self-pure, the body's light illuminates the ten directions.
The mind reaches nowhere to abide, liberation attains purity, contemplation is like no thought.
Loud sounds are no sound, knowing there is a gate in the absence of a gate, the wisdom mirror illuminates the killing.
The side child is empty and pure, awakening is no object, sitting and lying in the empty dissipation.
Surpassing the humans and gods within, temporarily reaching the other shore to stand, washing away the mud in the mind.
Pure without dust or defilement, vowing to realize bodhi, the wisdom mirror has no spiritual darkness.
The wise always use brightness, although the dust and toil are cut off, the treasure trove naturally shines.
The pond is refined with golden sand and water, connecting the Dharma-nature stream, the flower opens and gives birth to the transformed child.
Speaking of my original roots, abiding in thought, always observing the true essence of the king of samÄdhi treasures.
Circling back to count the tripiá¹­aka, in the mind of Furuqi, there are people who single-mindedly contemplate the Buddha.
Contemplating the Buddha, entering deep meditation, sitting with an upright mind in the first watch of the night, the Western direction is before one's eyes.
Contemplating, one knows there is no contemplation; no contemplation is suchness. If one considers the meaning in this,
This is called the distinctive Dharma-nature; the Pure Land is in the mind. Foolish people seek it externally.
In the depths, there is a precious mirror; not recognizing it, one rests for a lifetime. The buddhas are in the mind.
If one cannot seek in this way, what is more wondrous and rare? Quickly take up and diligently cultivate.
Everyone has a precious mirror, but foolish people do not know how to polish it, and cannot reflect back on themselves.
Dust and dirt come even more. Every household has a precious mirror, but wise people know how to polish it.
Diligently reflecting back on themselves, dust and dirt do not come. The exceptional mind is always penetrating.
Recalling the Buddha is precisely non-arising.
Before being refined, it is not yet gold ore; gold is not found in the ore. The wise one allows it to be melted and refined.
True gold is seen within the intestines. The Buddha's thoughts are empty and formless; true suchness is silent and inexpressible.
The mouth speaks the teachings of written language; in this realm, thoughts are meditation; the Dharma of the hidden treasury of nirvana.
The secret is not transmitted; the mind is always used by oneself; the majestic virtue can save those with affinity.
